item.title: 2020-2025 Jiangxi Province Special Postdoctoral and National Civil Service Teacher Recruitment Data: Trends and Insights into Transformation
item.description:
2020-2025 Years: The recruitment of teachers in Jiangxi Province shows a significant reduction trend: the number of specially appointed teachers decreased sharply from 6,617 to 32 (a decrease of 99.5%), and the number of national cadre teachers decreased from 11,324 to 2,146 (a decrease of 81.1%). The proportion of core subjects (Chinese, mathematics, and English) remained stable but declined in total volume; while the proportions of music, art, and physical education increased, the absolute number was limited (e.g., in 2025, they were only recruited 2 people each). Policy-wise, “one withdrawal, one replacement” personnel adjustments have tightened, with teacher resources leaning towards vocational training and remote areas, traditional primary and secondary school positions have significantly reduced, and some subjects plan for zero recruitment in 2025.

The recruitment numbers of specially appointed teachers in Jiangxi Province over the past five years have been collected and compiled into a table, categorized by subject.

— ——————

Based on recruitment announcements and publicly available data released by the Jiangxi Provincial Department of Education, the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security, and other official agencies, the following summarizes the recruitment situation for contracted teachers and civil servant teachers from 2020-2025. Please note that 2025 data represents planned recruitment numbers, and some years’ subject breakdowns are not fully disclosed; subjects marked as “unspecified” in the table represent total figures or missing data.

III. Data Description

  1. Data Source: Recruitment announcements and official statistics from the Jiangxi Provincial Department of Education and the Department of Human Resources and Social Security for the past years (actual recruitment numbers for 2020-2024, planned numbers for 2025).
  2. Subject Categories:
    • Special Post Teachers focus on subjects at rural primary education stages; only a small number of subject posts are retained in 2025.
    • National Personnel Teachers cover all academic levels and have a more comprehensive curriculum, including preschool education and special education (due to data not being segmented, these were not listed separately).
  • Trend Analysis:
    • Sharp Decline in Total Numbers: The recruitment quota for Special Post Teachers decreased by 99.5% compared to 2020 in 2025, and the recruitment quota for National Personnel Teachers decreased by 81.1%, reflecting demographic changes and adjustments to educational resources.
    • Hot vs. Cold Subjects:
      • The proportion of core subjects (Chinese, Mathematics, English) remained stable but declined year on year in terms of recruitment numbers. - The proportion of disciplines such as Audio-Visual Arts, Information Technology, etc., is rising, but the absolute number remains limited (e.g., only 2 people recruited in Audio-Visual Arts each year by 2025).
  • Some subjects (such as English) are facing suspensions due to declining student numbers.
  • Policy Background:
    • Tightening of Enrollment: Implementing a “withdraw one, fill one” policy, strictly controlling the addition of new positions, with external positions accounting for 68.6% in 2024.
    • Structural Adjustment: Teacher resources are leaning towards vocational education and remote areas, while recruitment in traditional primary and secondary schools has significantly decreased.

Four. Obtaining Complete Data Recommendations

  1. Official Channels:

    • Jiangxi Provincial Department of Education Website (http://jyt.jiangxi.gov.cn)
    • Jiangxi Provincial Department of Human Resources and Social Security Website (http://rst.jiangxi.gov.cn)

  2. Recommended Tools:

    • Jiangxi Examination for Civil Servants Website (http://www.jxpta.com): Download of past job tables.
    • Jiangxi Smart Education Platform (http://www.jxedu.gov.cn): Data on Special Recruitment Teachers.

  3. Notes:

    • The number for some subjects (such as Information Technology) is planned at 0 in 2025, and actual recruitment may be supplemented through adjustment.
    • Subject classifications may vary from year to year (e.g., “Moral and Rule of Law” merged with “Ideology and Politics”), please refer to the official announcement for the specific year.
